ctu.nengoros.comm.rosBackend.encoders.impl

Class MultiTerminationEncoderImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • ctu.nengoros.comm.rosBackend.encoders.impl.MultiTerminationEncoderImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Resettable, MultiTerminationEncoder

    public class MultiTerminationEncoderImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements MultiTerminationEncoder
    The same as BasicEncoder, but this one can have multiple Terminations (inputs), where the inputs on these Terminations are combined together. The resulting value is encoded and sent over the ROS network immediately, but can be also obtained by the getOutput() methid.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiTerminationEncoderImpl

        public MultiTerminationEncoderImpl(Node node,
                           DynamicalSystem dynamics,
                           Integrator integrator,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           java.lang.String dataType,
                           Units u,
                           ModemContainer modem,
                           Backend ros)
                            throws StructuralException

        Create MultiEncoder with dimension sizes determined by the ROS message type (currently only 1 dimension is supported).

        The constructor adds one Termination automatically by default, this is left unconnected.

        Parameters:
        node - parent of this Termination
        dynamics - DynamicalSystem defining properties of the input
        integrator - Integrator defining properties of the input
        name - name of this Encoder
        dataType - determines type of data to be encoded to the ROS network
        u - Nengo Units
        modem - a ROS node which registers ROS Publishers/Subscribers for the ROS communication
        ros - Backend that is used for direct communication with ROS infrastructure (e.g. encode/send)
        Throws:
        StructuralException

      • MultiTerminationEncoderImpl

        public MultiTerminationEncoderImpl(Node node,
                           DynamicalSystem dynamics,
                           Integrator integrator,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           int[] dimensionSizes,
                           java.lang.String dataType,
                           Units u,
                           ModemContainer modem,
                           Backend ros)
                            throws StructuralException
        Create BesicEncoder with given dimension sizes. Currently only one dimension is supported.
        Parameters:
        node - parent of this Termination
        dynamics - DynamicalSystem defining properties of the input
        integrator - Integrator defining properties of the input
        name - name of this Encoder
        dimensionSizes - array defining sizes of ROS message dimensions (to be translated into vector of floats for Nengo)
        dataType - determines type of data to be encoded to the ROS network
        u - Nengo Units
        modem - a ROS node which registers ROS Publishers/Subscribers for the ROS communication
        ros - Backend that is used for direct communication with ROS infrastructure (e.g. encode/send)
        Throws:
        StructuralException

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run(float startTime,
       float endTime)
         throws SimulationException
        Collect data on my input (on all my Terminations), encode data and publish over the ROS network.
        Specified by:
        run in interface MultiTerminationEncoder
        Parameters:
        startTime - simulation time at which running starts
        endTime - simulation time at which running ends
        Throws:
        SimulationException - if a problem is encountered while trying to run

      • getOutput

        public TimeSeries getOutput()
        Typically called by the Node to which the Termination belongs, here this method is probably unused, everything is handled just in the method run(). The received values are encoded there and sent over the ROS network.
        Returns:
        The most recent input on Terminations

      • reset

        public void reset(boolean randomize)
        Specified by:
        reset in interface Resettable
        Parameters:
        randomize - True indicates that the object should be reset to a randomly selected initial state (the object must be aware of the distribution from which to draw from). False indicates that the object should be reset to a fixed initial state (which it must also know). Some objects may not support randomization of the initial state, in which case a fixed state will be used in either case.
        See Also:
        Resettable.reset(boolean)
